document_title: Premenopausal menorrhagia: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Women can recognize premenopausal menorrhagia through some common signs below:
Menstruation lasts more than 7 days, even lasts more than 10 days;; There are symptoms of anemia such as fatigue, pale skin, lack of vitality;; Heavy menstrual bleeding, especially at night, affects sleep;; There may be severe or dull pain in the lower abdomen.
subsection_title: rong kinh tien man kinh.json. Identification signs
